title: Extracting Monster Bash sounds
content:
Well, I finally got some time to poke around with the code on Gerald Lindsly's site and it works like a charm! Szevvy, I recall you mentioning somewhere you had some issues with the decompression code (dropping bytes at the end I think.) Which files did you have trouble with? I haven't encountered any problems so far, but I've only tried it with a few files.

I also did up a 4-bit VOC decoder so I can listen to some of the sounds - here's one that's been decompressed and decoded. I've resampled it to 11025Hz and converted to .wav so you can listen to it in your favourite proggy [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-wink.gif[/img]

[url=http://members.optushome.com.au/malvineous/digi_dog-11k.wav]digi_dog-11k.wav[/url]

title: Re: Extracting Monster Bash sounds
content: wow this is a pretty neat find[img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-smile.gif[/img]

title: Re: Extracting Monster Bash sounds
content:
Heh, I fixed that decompression bug ~6 months ago [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-grin.gif[/img]

Wombat *should* auto-magically let you play the .vocs from Monster Bash, and let you export them as .wav - but if that's not working for you do let me know.

If you need any info on Monster Bash stuff (other than sprites) do let me know and I'll send you what I have.----------------------
Support (at least partially) for 27 games!
Check out the progress of Wombat Game Tools [url=http://student.ci.qut.edu.au/~n4738667/index.php?section=wombatwip]here[/url]

title: Re: Extracting Monster Bash sounds
content:
Oh ok, I've been catching up on about two years' worth of forum reading, so I've lost track of what happened when [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-wink.gif[/img]

I'm using Wombat 0.4, but it won't convert the VOCs - it only extracts them unchanged. Of course I'm running it under Linux through Wine, so it's quite possibly a Wine issue instead.

Thanks for the offer of the Monster Bash info - once I've got my editor to a more usable state, I'll probably take you up on that [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-smile.gif[/img]

title: hmm
content: Did you use the export button?  That should convert them to .wavs just fine, as it doesn't use Windows calls at all.

title: Re: hmm
content: Nope, the export button is greyed out...it flicks on and off when viewing the levels, but for the sounds it's always greyed out.
